meanings.definition: A group of proteins in the blood that bind to free hemoglobin.
meanings.sent1: Haptoglobins are like helpers that catch free hemoglobin in the blood.
meanings.sent2: The haptoglobins in the blood attach to loose hemoglobin to keep it in check.
meanings.sent3: When hemoglobin is naughty and wanders off, haptoglobins come to the rescue.
meanings.sent4: Like magnets for hemoglobin, haptoglobins ensure it doesn't roam freely.
meanings.sent5: In the blood, haptoglobins act as hemoglobin guardians, preventing chaos.

meanings.definition: A type of glycoprotein that helps in the clearance of free hemoglobin in the bloodstream.
meanings.sent1: The glycoprotein haptoglobins assist in cleaning up free hemoglobin in the blood.
meanings.sent2: In the bloodstream, haptoglobins play a crucial role in removing excess hemoglobin.
meanings.sent3: Haptoglobins are like the cleanup crew for hemoglobin parties in the blood.
meanings.sent4: The bloodstream relies on haptoglobins to tidy up any stray hemoglobin.
meanings.sent5: Imagine haptoglobins as tiny janitors, sweeping away free hemoglobin in the blood.
